sentences.text: Hi David, thanks for joining. Can you see my screen okay?
Perfect. I'm Alex from Phantom Sec, and I'm excited to learn about your compliance needs.
Yes, I can see everything clearly. Thanks for reaching out, Alex.
I'm David, the CISO here at TechGuard Solutions.
Great to meet you, David. I saw you're based in Austin - how's the weather there?
It's actually beautiful today, about 75 degrees. Much better than last week's heat wave!
Are you calling from San Francisco?
Yes, typical foggy morning here. Austin sounds much nicer!
So David, I'd love to understand what brought you to explore compliance automation solutions.
Well, we're a growing cybersecurity company, about 200 employees now, and our enterprise customers are requiring SOC 2 and ISO 27001.
We're currently using Secureframe, but honestly, we're spending way too much time on manual processes even with their platform.
Their expert guidance is helpful, but we need more automation. Our team is technical and doesn't need as much hand-holding.
We've been with them for about 8 months now, and while they got us through our initial SOC 2, the ongoing maintenance is killing us.
Every month we're manually uploading evidence, taking screenshots, and their integration gaps mean we're writing scripts.
I hear that a lot from companies switching from Secureframe. What specific manual processes are taking up time?
And when you mention integration gaps, which tools are you struggling to connect?
Evidence collection is still pretty manual. We have to upload screenshots and documents regularly instead of having continuous monitoring.
Also, their integration library is limited. We use some tools that aren't supported, so we're building custom scripts to bridge the gaps.
We also looked at Drata, but their platform seemed overly complex for what we need, and the pricing was significantly higher.
The specific tools we can't integrate are Datadog for monitoring, Linear for issue tracking, and our custom security scanning tools.
Our engineers estimate they spend about 15-20 hours per week just maintaining these compliance integrations and collecting evidence.
With Drata, they wanted almost $50,000 annually, and their platform requires a dedicated compliance engineer to manage it.
We even had a demo with them, and it took them 45 minutes just to explain their dashboard. That's when we knew it wasn't right for us.
That makes complete sense. Phantom Sec actually automates up to 90% of evidence collection with continuous monitoring across all your systems.
We have over 380 integrations - the most comprehensive in the market - so you won't need those custom scripts anymore.
And unlike Drata's complexity or Secureframe's manual approach, we balance powerful automation with an intuitive interface.
I actually have many customers who switched from Secureframe specifically because of the manual burden you're describing.
One of them, a 250-person SaaS company, reduced their compliance overhead from 30 hours a week to just 3 hours.
And yes, we support Datadog, Linear, and we have APIs for custom security tools. Everything connects seamlessly.
380 integrations sounds impressive. Do you support tools like PagerDuty and Jira as well?
Those are some of the other gaps we're facing with Secureframe right now.
Also, how does your platform handle custom security policies? We have some unique requirements as a cybersecurity company.
Secureframe's templates are pretty rigid, and we've had to do a lot of manual customization outside their platform.
That's another reason we looked at other options. But honestly, everyone seems to have trade-offs.
Yes, we support PagerDuty, Jira, and hundreds more. In fact, we add new integrations every month based on customer requests.
What really sets us apart is our AI Agent that can guide your team through compliance workflows and automate repetitive tasks.
This is something unique to Phantom Sec - neither Secureframe nor Drata has this level of AI-powered automation.
For custom policies, we have a flexible policy editor that lets you create and modify policies while maintaining compliance alignment.
Many cybersecurity companies use us specifically because we understand the need for customization without sacrificing automation.
You can inherit from our templates or build completely custom ones. Everything stays within the platform for audit purposes.
The AI Agent sounds interesting. We also evaluated Sprinto - they claim 99% automation. How do you compare?
Their sales team was pretty aggressive about that number, but I'm skeptical about what 99% really means.
We had a technical evaluation with them, and while the automation was impressive, the setup seemed incredibly complex.
Our engineering team was concerned about the implementation timeline - they quoted us 8-10 weeks just to get started.
Plus, they're a newer player. We're not sure about their long-term stability, especially for something as critical as compliance.
Great question. While Sprinto does offer high automation, many customers find their interface overwhelming and setup quite complex.
Our 90% automation is more realistic and sustainable. Plus, we can get you compliant in 4-8 weeks versus their longer timelines.
We also have better brand recognition, which matters when you're sharing compliance status with your enterprise customers.
You're absolutely right to be skeptical about 99%. In reality, there will always be some manual oversight required for compliance.
What we focus on is automating the truly repetitive tasks while giving you control over the strategic decisions.
As for stability, we've been in this space since 2018, we're well-funded, and we have over 12,000 customers globally.
Companies like Atlassian, Quora, and Carta trust us with their compliance. That kind of validation took years to build.
That's a good point about brand recognition. What about security questionnaires? We're drowning in those from customers.
Last month alone, we had 47 security questionnaires. Each one takes our team 2-3 hours to complete properly.
Secureframe has some questionnaire features, but we still end up copying and pasting from old responses manually.
It's actually becoming a bottleneck for our sales team. Deals are getting delayed because of questionnaire turnaround times.
Our VP of Sales is really pushing us to find a solution that can handle these automatically. It's impacting revenue.
Our questionnaire automation is best-in-class with an 80% auto-approval rate using AI-powered responses.
We also offer Trust Center capabilities where customers can self-serve compliance documentation, reducing questionnaires by 60%.
This is a major differentiator - most competitors don't have this level of customer-facing trust features.
For those 47 questionnaires you mentioned, our AI would handle about 38 of them completely automatically.
The system learns from your previous responses and continuously improves. Most customers see response time drop from hours to minutes.
One of our customers, a security company like yours, went from 120 hours per month on questionnaires to just 15 hours.
Neither Secureframe nor Drata has AI questionnaire automation at this level. It's a game-changer for sales velocity.
This all sounds great. What kind of investment are we looking at compared to what we're paying now?
Secureframe is costing us about $15,000 annually, but we feel we're not getting enough value.
For context, Drata quoted us $48,000 for similar frameworks, and Sprinto was around $35,000 with their setup fees.
We have budget approval for up to $50,000 if the solution truly solves our automation and questionnaire problems.
But it needs to be justified. My CFO is very ROI-focused, especially after our Secureframe experience.
For a 200-person company like yours with SOC 2 and ISO 27001, you're looking at approximately $30,000-$40,000 annually.
While that's more than Secureframe's entry price, you're getting significantly more automation and capabilities.
Most customers see a 526% ROI over three years when you factor in time savings and faster sales cycles.
Let me break down the value: You mentioned 15-20 hours per week on compliance. That's roughly $100,000 in engineering costs annually.
With our 90% automation, you'll reduce that to 2-3 hours per week, saving you about $80,000 per year.
Add the questionnaire automation saving another 100+ hours monthly, and you're looking at total savings exceeding $150,000 annually.
So while we're more expensive than Secureframe, we're actually the most cost-effective when you consider the full picture.
That's within our budget, especially if it truly reduces our manual work by 90%.
The ROI makes sense when I think about how much engineering time we're wasting on compliance.
But I'm concerned about the migration process. We have a lot of data in Secureframe. How complex is the switch?
We can't afford to lose our audit history or have gaps in our compliance posture during a transition.
Great question about migration. We have a dedicated migration team that handles Secureframe transitions regularly.
We'll export all your existing evidence, policies, and audit history. Nothing gets lost in the transition.
The whole migration typically takes just 2-3 weeks, and we run in parallel with your existing system to ensure no gaps.
You'll have a dedicated implementation specialist, but the platform is intuitive enough for self-service after that.
We've migrated hundreds of companies from Secureframe, Drata, and even homegrown systems. It's a smooth process.
In fact, most customers are surprised at how easy it is. Your team can focus on their work while we handle the technical migration.
That's much faster than what we experienced with Secureframe. Who else needs to be involved in this decision?
I'll need to loop in our CTO and CFO, and probably our head of engineering who manages the integrations.
Our CTO will want to understand the technical architecture and how the AI actually works. He's very detail-oriented.
The CFO will focus on the ROI and contract terms. She'll probably want to see customer references too.
What's your typical evaluation process look like? We'd like to make a decision within the next 3-4 weeks if possible.
Perfect timing. I'd love to set up a technical deep-dive with your CTO and engineering lead next week.
I can show them exactly how our integrations work and how the AI Agent can streamline your workflows.
I'll also prepare a detailed ROI analysis comparing us to Secureframe to help with the CFO conversation.
For the 3-4 week timeline, that's very doable. We typically see: Week 1 technical evaluation, Week 2 business case review.
Week 3 for contract negotiations and references, then Week 4 for final approvals. We can absolutely meet your timeline.
I'll also connect you with a customer who switched from Secureframe last year. They're a similar size and industry.
That would be excellent. Can we aim for Tuesday or Wednesday next week?
And please include information about migrating from Secureframe - I want to understand that process.
The customer reference would be really valuable. Hearing from someone who's made the switch would help build confidence internally.
One last question - what about ongoing support? Secureframe's support has been hit or miss for us.
Great question about support. We offer 24/7 support with average response times under 2 hours.
Unlike Secureframe's email-only support, we have live chat, phone, and a dedicated Slack channel for your team.
You'll also have a Customer Success Manager who meets with you monthly to ensure you're getting maximum value.
Tuesday afternoon works perfectly. I'll send the invite for 2 PM your time with all the relevant materials.
I'll include our migration playbook and that comparison chart showing how we stack up against Secureframe.
Excellent. This has been really eye-opening, Alex. I had no idea we were missing so much with Secureframe.
The AI capabilities and questionnaire automation alone could be game-changers for us.
I'm going to brief my team this afternoon. I think they'll be excited about the possibility of real automation.
Thanks for taking the time to understand our specific challenges and not just giving a generic pitch.
My pleasure, David. I really appreciate your openness about the challenges you're facing.
I'm confident Phantom Sec can solve these automation challenges and get you back to focusing on growth.
I'll get that calendar invite out within the hour, along with all the materials we discussed.
Looking forward to our technical session next Tuesday. Have a great rest of your day!
Thanks Alex, you too. Really looking forward to getting out of this Secureframe situation.
Talk to you Tuesday. Bye!
Hi Sarah, this is Jamie from Phantom Sec. How are you doing today?
I see you're joining from Seattle. How's the weather up there?
Hi Jamie, I'm doing well, thanks! Yes, typical Seattle - a bit rainy today.
I'm Sarah Martinez, the VP of Security at CloudFirst Technologies.
Nice to meet you Sarah! I appreciate you taking the time today.
I noticed CloudFirst just raised your Series B - congratulations! That must be exciting.
Thank you! Yes, it's been quite a journey. We're scaling rapidly now.
Actually, that's part of why I'm talking to you. Our investors are asking about our compliance posture.
That's very common after a funding round. What specific compliance requirements are they asking about?
They want us to achieve SOC 2 Type II within the next 6 months, and we're starting from basically nothing.
We're a 150-person company, mostly engineers, and we've been focused on product development until now.
I've been researching solutions and came across Phantom Sec, but I also looked at Drata and TrustCloud.
Great that you're evaluating options. What did you find when you looked at Drata and TrustCloud?
Drata seems very technical, which could be good for our team, but the pricing was really high - over $45,000.
TrustCloud was more affordable at around $20,000, but their platform seemed pretty basic from the demo.
They don't have many integrations, and we'd still need to do a lot of manual evidence collection.
I understand. It sounds like you're looking for something that balances automation with reasonable pricing.
Can you tell me more about your current tech stack? That'll help me understand your integration needs.
Sure! We're on AWS for infrastructure, using GitHub for code, Jira for tickets, and Slack for communication.
We also use Okta for identity management, Datadog for monitoring, and BambooHR for our HR system.
One challenge is we have some custom-built tools for deployment and security scanning that need to be included.
Perfect, we integrate with all of those platforms natively - AWS, GitHub, Jira, Slack, Okta, Datadog, and BambooHR.
For your custom tools, we have APIs that can pull in that evidence automatically as well.
This is actually a key differentiator - we have over 380 integrations, more than Drata or TrustCloud.
That's impressive. How much of the compliance work can actually be automated?
With TrustCloud, they said we'd still need someone spending 20+ hours a week on compliance tasks.
We automate about 90% of the evidence collection and monitoring. Most of our customers spend just 2-3 hours per week.
Unlike TrustCloud's manual approach, our AI continuously monitors your controls and alerts you to any issues.
We also have an AI Agent that can guide your team through any compliance tasks, which neither competitor offers.
The AI Agent sounds interesting. We don't have any compliance experts on staff.
Another pain point is security questionnaires. We're getting more of these from enterprise customers.
Last month we had 15 questionnaires, and each one took our team 3-4 hours to complete.
Security questionnaires are a huge time sink. Our AI-powered questionnaire automation handles 80% automatically.
For those 15 questionnaires, you'd probably complete 12 of them in minutes instead of hours.
Neither Drata nor TrustCloud has this level of questionnaire automation - it's unique to Phantom Sec.
That would be a game-changer for us. What about the implementation timeline?
Drata told us 8-10 weeks, and TrustCloud said 6-8 weeks. We need to move faster than that.
We can get you up and running in 3-4 weeks. Our implementation is much more streamlined.
The key is our automation - while others require manual setup, we automatically discover and configure your controls.
You could realistically be ready for your SOC 2 audit within 2 months of starting with us.
That timeline works well for us. What about pricing? What kind of investment are we looking at?
As I mentioned, Drata was $45,000 and TrustCloud was $20,000, but with very different capabilities.
For a 150-person company going for SOC 2, you're looking at approximately $28,000-$32,000 annually.
So we're right in the middle price-wise, but with significantly more automation than TrustCloud.
When you factor in the time savings - going from 20+ hours to 2-3 hours weekly - the ROI is very strong.
That seems reasonable. Can you break down what's included in that price?
With TrustCloud, they wanted to charge extra for additional frameworks and for their 'premium' support.
Our pricing includes everything - the platform, all integrations, AI features, and premium support.
Unlike TrustCloud, we don't nickel and dime you. If you need ISO 27001 later, it's a minimal add-on.
You also get 24/7 support through chat, phone, and Slack - not just email like some competitors.
This is really helpful. I need to discuss this with our CTO and CEO. What are the next steps?
They'll want to see a demo of the actual platform, especially the automation and AI features.
Perfect! I'd love to schedule a technical demo with you and your CTO. How does Thursday afternoon look?
I can show you exactly how the automation works with your specific tech stack.
I'll also prepare a comparison chart showing Phantom Sec versus Drata and TrustCloud side by side.
Thursday at 3 PM Pacific would work great. Can you include our Head of Engineering too?
The comparison chart would be really valuable - it'll help me make the case internally.
Absolutely! I'll send a calendar invite for Thursday at 3 PM Pacific with a Zoom link.
I'll also send over some case studies of similar companies who switched from TrustCloud to Phantom Sec.
Perfect! This has been really informative. You've addressed a lot of my concerns.
I'm looking forward to seeing the platform in action on Thursday.
Excellent, Sarah! I'm confident we can help CloudFirst achieve SOC 2 quickly and efficiently.
I'll get those materials over to you today. Have a great rest of your Tuesday!
Thanks Jamie! Talk to you Thursday. Bye!
Good morning Dr. Patel, this is Marcus from Phantom Sec. Thanks for making time today.
I understand you're the Chief Technology Officer at MediCore Health Systems?
Yes, that's correct Marcus. Please, call me Raj.
We're a digital health platform with about 300 employees.
300 employees, that's great growth! How long have you been with MediCore?
I joined about 18 months ago to help scale our technology infrastructure.
We're handling sensitive health data, so compliance is becoming a major focus for us.
Absolutely, healthcare compliance is critical. What frameworks are you looking at?
We need HIPAA of course, but also SOC 2 for our enterprise health system partners.
We tried managing this internally for the past year, but it's not scalable anymore.
I've been evaluating Sprinto heavily, and also looked at Secureframe briefly.
I see. What's your experience been with Sprinto so far?
Their automation is impressive - the 99% claim - but I'm concerned about HIPAA expertise.
In our demo, they seemed more focused on general SaaS compliance, not healthcare specifics.
Plus, their implementation timeline of 10-12 weeks seems long for our urgent needs.
Healthcare compliance does require specialized knowledge. We actually have a dedicated healthcare team.
Many of our healthcare clients switched from Sprinto specifically because of our HIPAA expertise.
That's interesting. What about your automation capabilities compared to Sprinto?
We have a lot of legacy systems that need to integrate - EHR systems, medical devices, etc.
We automate 90% of evidence collection, which is more realistic than 99% claims.
More importantly, we have pre-built integrations for major EHR systems like Epic and Cerner.
For medical devices, our API framework can connect to any system that exposes data.
EHR integrations would save us months of work. Sprinto didn't have those.
What about the Business Associate Agreement requirements? That's been a pain point.
We have automated BAA tracking and management built into the platform.
You can track all your vendors, their BAA status, and get alerts for renewals.
This is something unique to us - neither Sprinto nor Secureframe has this healthcare focus.
This sounds more aligned with our needs. What's the investment level?
Sprinto quoted us $42,000 annually, which seemed high for what we'd get.
For a 300-person healthcare company with HIPAA and SOC 2, you're looking at $45,000-$50,000.
It's slightly more than Sprinto, but you're getting healthcare-specific features they don't have.
Most healthcare clients see ROI within 6 months from reduced audit costs and faster partner onboarding.
The healthcare focus definitely justifies the price. What's next in the evaluation?
I'd recommend a technical demo with your security team to show the HIPAA controls.
I can also connect you with our healthcare clients who made similar transitions.
Perfect. Let's schedule that for next week. This has been very helpful, Marcus.
Excellent! I'll send the invite today. Thanks for your time, Raj!
Good afternoon Linda, this is Rachel from Phantom Sec. Thanks for taking my call.
I know you're busy as Chief Compliance Officer at Meridian Financial.
Hi Rachel. Yes, compliance never sleeps in financial services!
But this is important - we need to modernize our compliance infrastructure.
I completely understand. Tell me about Meridian's current situation.
We're a wealth management firm with about 1,200 employees across 15 offices.
We manage $8 billion in assets, so regulatory compliance is absolutely critical for us.
Currently, we're using a combination of manual processes and Drata for SOC 2.
How's your experience been with Drata for your compliance needs?
Honestly, Drata works well for SOC 2, but we need much more than that.
We need SEC compliance, FINRA requirements, state regulations - Drata doesn't cover those.
Plus, their platform is very technical. Our compliance team struggles with it.
Financial services compliance is complex. Have you looked at other solutions?
We evaluated TrustCloud, but they're too basic for our enterprise needs.
They quoted us $25,000, which is attractive, but they can't handle our complexity.
We need something that can scale with us and handle multiple regulatory frameworks.
That's exactly why financial services firms choose Phantom Sec over Drata or TrustCloud.
We have pre-built frameworks for SEC, FINRA, and state-level financial regulations.
That's interesting. What about integration with our existing systems?
We use specialized financial software - portfolio management systems, trading platforms.
We integrate with major financial platforms like Charles River, Bloomberg, and Advent.
Unlike Drata's generic approach, we understand financial services data flows.
We also automate regulatory reporting, which neither Drata nor TrustCloud offers.
Regulatory reporting automation would save us dozens of hours monthly.
What about audit trails? Our regulators require detailed documentation.
We provide immutable audit trails that exceed regulatory requirements.
Every change, every access, every report - all tracked and timestamped automatically.
This is enterprise-grade compliance, not the SMB-focused tools you've been evaluating.
This sounds like what we need. What's the investment for an enterprise solution?
Drata is costing us $55,000 annually just for SOC 2.
For a 1,200-person financial services firm with your requirements, it's $85,000-$95,000.
That includes all frameworks, integrations, and our white-glove enterprise support.
Consider that you're replacing Drata AND getting financial regulatory compliance.
When you put it that way, it's actually quite reasonable.
We spend more than that annually just on compliance consultants.
Exactly. Should we schedule a demo with your compliance and IT teams?
I can show how we handle SEC reporting and multi-framework management.
Yes, let's do that. Can you also bring a financial services reference?
I'd like to hear from someone who's been through a regulatory audit with your platform.
Absolutely! I'll connect you with our clients at Pinnacle Advisors.
They just passed their SEC examination using our platform. Thanks Linda!
Perfect. Looking forward to it, Rachel. Have a great day!
Hey Tom, this is Derek from Phantom Sec. How's it going?
I saw DataVault just announced your seed funding - congrats!
Hey Derek, thanks! Yeah, it's been a crazy few weeks.
I'm Tom, the co-founder and CTO here.
Awesome! How big is the team now?
We're 35 people, mostly engineers. Growing to 50 by end of quarter.
Our investors are pushing us to get SOC 2 certified ASAP for enterprise deals.
Classic post-funding requirement! What have you looked at so far?
I've been demo-ing everything - Secureframe, Drata, Sprinto, TrustCloud.
Honestly, they all seem pretty similar. I'm trying to figure out the real differences.
Secureframe seems popular with startups, but I'm not sure if it's just good marketing.
I get it. What's been your impression of each so far?
Secureframe has good hand-holding, but it feels too manual for a tech-forward team like ours.
Drata is super technical which I like, but their UI is confusing and the price is steep.
Sprinto promises 99% automation but their demo felt buggy. Plus they're newer.
TrustCloud is cheap but seems really basic. I don't think they'd scale with us.
Great analysis. What matters most to you in choosing a solution?
Speed to compliance is huge - we have enterprise deals waiting on SOC 2.
But also automation. I can't have my engineers wasting time on compliance busy work.
And it needs to be developer-friendly. My team will revolt if the UX is bad.
Makes total sense. We actually focus on exactly that - developer-first compliance.
We can get you SOC 2 ready in 4-6 weeks with 90% automation.
Unlike Secureframe's manual approach or Drata's complexity, we're built for startups like yours.
4-6 weeks would be amazing. What about integrations?
We use GitHub, AWS, Datadog, Slack, Linear - pretty standard startup stack.
We integrate with all of those out of the box. 380+ integrations total.
More than Secureframe, and definitely more than TrustCloud or Sprinto.
Plus our AI Agent helps your team understand what's needed without compliance expertise.
The AI thing is interesting. None of the others really emphasized that.
How does it actually work? Is it just marketing fluff or actually useful?
It's legit. The AI guides you through each control, suggests evidence, and even writes policies.
For example, it'll detect you're using AWS and automatically configure the right security controls.
This is unique to us - the others just give you templates and checklists.
Okay, that's actually pretty cool. What's the damage pricing-wise?
Secureframe quoted $12K, Drata was $25K, Sprinto $18K, and TrustCloud was $8K.
For a 35-person startup, we're at $15,000 annually. Right in the middle.
But you get more automation than Secureframe, simpler than Drata, more reliable than Sprinto.
And way more capable than TrustCloud. Plus, we have startup-friendly payment terms.
That's reasonable. Do you offer monthly billing? Cash flow is tight.
Absolutely. We can do monthly or quarterly. We know how startups operate.
We also have a startup program with additional discounts if you're interested.
This is helpful. I need to sync with my co-founder who handles the business side.
Can you send me a comparison sheet? I'm drowning in sales materials.
I'll send you a one-page comparison of us vs the others you mentioned.
Want to do a quick technical demo next week? I can show the actual platform.
Yeah, let's do it. Tuesday or Thursday afternoon works for me.
Perfect! I'll send a Tuesday invite. Thanks for the time, Tom!
Good luck with the growth - exciting times ahead!
Thanks Derek! Talk Tuesday. Later!
Hi Maria, this is Lisa from Phantom Sec. How are you doing today?
I know Black Friday is coming up - must be a busy time at StyleHub!
Hi Lisa! Yes, it's absolutely crazy here. Q4 is our biggest quarter.
I'm Maria, the Head of Information Security at StyleHub.
I can imagine! How many transactions do you process during peak season?
Last Black Friday we hit 50,000 transactions per hour. It's intense.
We're a 400-person company but our customer data is growing exponentially.
That's why compliance is becoming critical - we handle millions of payment cards.
PCI compliance must be a major focus then. What's your current approach?
We need PCI DSS Level 1, plus SOC 2 for our enterprise retail partners.
Right now we're using TrustCloud, but honestly, it's not working out.
We also tested Drata last year but decided against it. Too complicated.
What specific issues are you having with TrustCloud?
Their PCI DSS support is basically non-existent. It's all manual checklists.
They promised automation but we're still doing everything by hand.
Plus, they only have like 50 integrations. We use tools they've never heard of.
For $22,000 a year, we expected more. We're definitely switching.
That's frustrating. What made you decide against Drata when you evaluated them?
Drata felt like it was built for tech companies, not e-commerce.
They didn't understand our payment flows or inventory systems.
And at $40,000, it was way over budget for something that didn't fit.
E-commerce compliance is unique. We actually specialize in retail and payments.
We have pre-built integrations for Shopify, payment gateways, and inventory systems.
Really? Do you integrate with Shopify Plus and Stripe?
Those are our core platforms. TrustCloud doesn't support either.
Yes! We have deep integrations with both, plus all major payment processors.
For PCI DSS, we automatically monitor your cardholder data environment.
No manual checklists - it's all automated scanning and evidence collection.
That would save us so much time. What about seasonal traffic spikes?
Our infrastructure scales 10x during Black Friday. Can you handle that?
Absolutely. Our monitoring adapts to your traffic patterns automatically.
We work with major e-commerce brands who see similar seasonal spikes.
Unlike TrustCloud or Drata, we understand e-commerce infrastructure needs.
This sounds much better aligned. What's the pricing structure?
We're paying TrustCloud $22,000 but not getting value.
For a 400-person e-commerce company with PCI and SOC 2, it's $35,000-$40,000.
Yes, it's more than TrustCloud, but you get actual automation and PCI expertise.
Most e-commerce clients see 70% reduction in compliance workload.
The automation alone would justify that. We waste so much time now.
Can we migrate our existing compliance data from TrustCloud?
Yes, we have a migration team that handles TrustCloud transitions.
Should we set up a demo focused on e-commerce workflows?
Definitely. Can you show the Shopify and payment integrations?
I'll bring our payments team lead - they need to see this.
Perfect! I'll focus the demo on your e-commerce use cases.
Good luck with Black Friday prep, Maria!
Thanks Lisa! Looking forward to the demo. Bye!
Hi Robert, this is Samantha from Phantom Sec. Thanks for joining today!
I see you're with EduTech Pro - exciting space to be in right now.
Hi Samantha, yes it's been quite a journey. I'm Robert, VP of Engineering.
We're seeing huge growth in the K-12 market especially.
That's fantastic! How many school districts are you working with now?
We're in about 800 districts across 35 states, serving 2.5 million students.
With 250 employees, we're struggling to keep up with compliance demands.
School districts require FERPA compliance, plus many want SOC 2 and state-specific certifications.
Education compliance is complex. What's your current approach?
We've been trying to manage it ourselves, but it's becoming unsustainable.
I've been evaluating solutions - looked at Secureframe pretty seriously.
Also had demos with TrustCloud and briefly considered Sprinto.
What's been your impression of those platforms for your needs?
Secureframe has good guidance, which we need, but they don't understand education.
They kept talking about HIPAA when we need FERPA. It's completely different.
TrustCloud was affordable but too basic. No education-specific features at all.
Sprinto's automation looked good but their sales team couldn't answer education questions.
Education data privacy is unique. We actually have a dedicated education compliance team.
We work with many EdTech companies and understand FERPA, COPPA, and state laws.
That's exactly what we need. Do you handle state-specific requirements?
California has SOPIPA, New York has Ed Law 2-D, Texas has SB 89...
It's a nightmare trying to track all these different student privacy laws.
We maintain templates for all major state education privacy laws.
Our platform automatically maps your controls to each state's requirements.
This is something none of our competitors offer - they focus on general compliance.
That would be huge. What about integrations with education platforms?
We use Google Workspace for Education, Clever, Canvas LMS, and custom APIs.
We integrate with all major education platforms - Google, Clever, Canvas, Schoology.
Plus we understand student data flows and can monitor for proper data minimization.
Secureframe and others treat education like any other vertical, but it's not.
Absolutely. We deal with minors' data - the stakes are much higher.
How do you handle district security assessments? We get dozens every month.
Our AI handles education questionnaires specifically - knows FERPA language.
We can auto-respond to 85% of district security assessments accurately.
Most of our EdTech clients reduce questionnaire time from days to hours.
This sounds perfect for us. What's the investment level?
Secureframe quoted us $28,000 but without education features.
For a 250-person EdTech company with FERPA and SOC 2, you're looking at $35,000-$40,000.
It's more than Secureframe, but you get education expertise they can't provide.
Most EdTech clients see ROI within months from faster district approvals.
The education focus justifies the price. Time to market is critical.
Every week of delay in district approval costs us potential revenue.
Exactly. Should we set up a demo focused on education workflows?
I can show FERPA controls and state compliance mapping.
Yes, please. Can you include our compliance lead? She's ex-district.
She'll know immediately if this actually works for education.
Perfect! District experience is invaluable. How's Thursday morning?
